description.narrative: The key development problem which the project aims to find solutions to is the desertification leading to lack of livelihoods poverty and forced migration. The objective is sustainable use of natural resources and secured livelihood in the project areas. T he project started in 2012 and it has been planned for 10 years. This continuation project will be its 4th and final phase.The outcomes of 2019-2022 will be:1. Environmental centers developed into regional hubs2. Educational institutions and trainers have expertise to provide environmental education3. Resilience of local communities to climate change and drought improved4. Implementation of policies related to natural resource management (NRM)The outputs will be: 1.1. Seedlings of locally successful species produced planted distributed and sold per year 1.2. Seed collection stands established and local availability of the seeds of the most important species secured 1.3. Operating models for the environmental centers developed 2.1. Trainers trained and traini ng material produced 2.2. Training materials and research opportunities provided to universities and environmental education material provided to teachers 3.1. Charcoal and firewood consumption reduced in local communities 3.2. Agroforestry practices and s oil and water conservation techniques adopted in local communities 4.1. Network of the environmental actors built and environmental efforts and common initiatives coordinated at all project sites 4.2. Policy reviews and briefs produced for policy dialogu e with ministries of environment and implementation of environmental policies startedThe project is implemented at 3 sites in Somalia with the FSN's four partners in Finland and three partners in Somalia. The innovative cooperative model enforces the civil society in Somalia and creates new networks that also promote peace and stability.The beneficiaries are local communities authorities and educational institutions among others.
